Posts.Content: BabsBennett wrote: I had my biopsy on the 7th, and was diagnosed on the 9th with invasive ductal carcinoma and focal duct carcinoma in my left breast.  My doctor has ordered an MRI which will be sent along to the surgeon as well.  Does everyone go through an MRI after being diagnosed as a precaution? Or is it for stage/grade? Should I be concerned? Dx 1/9/2013, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Dx 1/9/2013, IDC, <1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Surgery 2/1/2013 Lumpectomy: Left Targeted Therapy 3/4/2013 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Chemotherapy 3/4/2013 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxotere (docetaxel) Radiation Therapy 7/23/2013 Breast, Lymph nodes Hormonal Therapy 8/25/2013 Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Bilateral Breast MRI BabsBennett jacee

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2013 12:11PM BabsBennett wrote: Thanks Diane! I'm still feeling kind of raw from the news and my mind can't shut down or process all this yet.

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2013 01:12PM BabsBennett wrote: I agree. The waiting is the worst. I wish you luck!

Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2013 11:56AM BabsBennett wrote: Thank you for the advice jacee, I've called ahead and let them know I want to take the CD of the MRI with me when I'm done and they said they will do that. I will follow up on the written as well.  Do I have to wait to meet with the surgeon before I know the results of the MRI? Or can I be informed of that before I go see the surgeon? I think God intends me to learn patience through all of this.
